tweets.text:
We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Nothing from Tony Juniper on this yet.....
@TonyJuniper

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency This is a job for @NaturalEngland who are the regulator for SSSIs - although sadly understandable why many wouldn't know that... https://t.co/PqrO4Kja1D

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Sadly not the first time this landowner has undertaken work of this nature on the River Lugg. Pleased to see action being taken @HerefordshireWT

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
@IvelRev @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency No they stole it.

Walking today in the beautiful sunshine I met a family also enjoying the magnificent colours. We paused to discuss the dry Ivel Springs. The child listening asked ‚Äú who broke the river?‚Äù So @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency who broke our chalk stream ? https://t.co/Ifth31WjGL

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

Thank you to all the @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm staff out on site working together to take action on reported damage at the #RiverLugg. Stop notices served and an investigation underway. https://t.co/moayq4k5aR
@DaveThroupEA @ChrisBaingerEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Why is no one from the IDB there ? @The_WMA
Our piece by @GlassJet on the depressing news of the destruction of a stretch of Herefordshire's River Lugg  @EnvAgency @WildlifeTrusts  https://t.co/CaNN4WVP5J

@Feargal_Sharkey @bettwsresident @WUFoundation @EnvAgencyMids @BBCSounds @bbchw @toniearlybird Here is the clipped section on You-Tube
https://t.co/2UIhkTpXIK

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil @AlanWilliamsb66 look at replies and see what some eejit has done on #riverlugg at Kingsland. Criminal and good to see it‚Äôs being investigated by @EnvAgency

@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm While you're at it can you explain why you mow all the wildflowers and their insect life off the Cottenham Lode every August instead of letting it bed down naturally?

The stupidity of of humans knows no bounds. While you‚Äôre at it why don‚Äôt you pour bleach down the river to get rid of the nasty bugs. A nice clean sterile river, lovely. I think humans have a phrase? FFS! @EnvAgency https://t.co/PMgx6P1nfU
